PostgreSQL Europe

Welcome to PostgreSQL Europe, the "umbrella group" for PostgreSQL User Groups in Europe and for users in regions that don't have a local user group. Our goal is to promote the use of PostgreSQL in Europe. We do this primarily by assisting local user groups to promote the product locally through conferences and other advocacy, as well as running European-wide conferences and other activities.

Latest news  

PGConf.DE 2024: Talk selection is almost completed

2024-02-16

The Call for Papers committee voted on most of the submitted talks, many speakers received a notification moments ago. There are currently 13 talks which need further investigation before a decision can be made. Please stay tuned, and book your #pgconfde ticket! #PostgreSQL #Conference #Munich #MÃ¼nchen #Konferenz

We again would like to thank all of you who submitted a talk proposal, and the Program Committee for their work on putting together a great schedule.

See you in Munich in April

PGConf.DE 2024: The Call for Papers is closed

2024-02-12

You may have noticed that the Call for Papers closed last Friday. We would like to thank everyone who submitted a talk, without you we would not be able to run the conference.

The Program Committee is already busy with voting all your talk submissions and we should be able to come up with the schedule beginning of March. Stay tuned.

See you in Munich in April

FOSDEM PGDay 2024: Waitlist activated

2024-01-30

Our waitlist has now been activated for capacity control, but we still a few tickets (less than 10) available for the event on Friday. If you want to join us, sign up on the waitlis, and you will receive a (time-limited) offer shortly thereafter.

PGConf.DE 2024: There is one week left for EARLY birds

2024-01-24

There is one week left to grab your early bird ticket, a few are still left. Hurry up as we expect them to sell out quite fast during the last week of the offering.

See you in Munich in April

Nordic PGDay 2024: Schedule announced and open for registration

2024-01-17

The schedule is now published and registration has now opened. Seats are limited so we recommend that you register early if you are interested! There are 30 Early bird discounted tickets available until the 21st of February 2024; grab yours before they run out or the campaign ends.

Nordic PGDay is proud to be a PostgreSQL Community Recognised Conference.

We look forward to seeing you in Oslo!
